title: Light, Shadows, and Reflection

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: Energy that lets us see things.
A dark area made when light is blocked.
Something you can see through clearly.
A material that does not let light pass through.
A material that lets some light through but not clearly.
When light bends as it passes through something.
To take in light or energy instead of reflecting it.

teachingNotes: Use flashlights and mirrors for hands-on experiments. Make shadow puppets. Demonstrate reflection with mirrors and shiny objects.
